arlut.csd.JTree
Class treeCanvas

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              arlut.csd.JTree.treeCanvas
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener
 class treeCanvas
extends javax.swing.JComponent
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener

This class is the actual rendering surface used by the JTree treeControl class.

treeCanvas

                  java.awt.Font font,
                  java.awt.Color fgColor,
                  java.awt.Color bgColor,
                  java.awt.Image[] images)
Constructor

Parameters:
font - Font for text in the Tree Canvas
fgColor - Foreground color for text in the treeCanvas
bgColor - Background color for text in the treeCanvas
images - Array of images to be used in the canvas; nodes refer to images by index

getBottomRow

int getBottomRow()
This method returns the index of the bottom-most visible row in the table.

render

void render()
This is our main rendering routine, which does all the work to generate our tree image, minus the drag/drop sprite effects.

recursiveGenStack

private void recursiveGenStack(treeNode node,
                               java.util.Stack stack)
Internal rendering method Should only be called from render(), which provides the thread-synchronized entry point. Generate and record information about the columns to the left of the current node, used by drawRow to properly position each drawn node in the hierarchy

drawRow

private void drawRow(treeNode node,
                     int row,
                     java.util.Vector s)
drawRow() is the internal rendering method for each row of the treeControl. Should only be called from render(), which provides the thread-synchronized entry point

Parameters:
node - The treeNode corresponding to the row to be drawn
row - The row's number in the overall tree's list of rows
s - A Stack containing LINE and SPACE objects that need to precede the icon and text for this node. We use this draw Stack to properly render the containment graphics for this row.

calcWidth

int calcWidth()
This method calculates the maximum width required for the tree in its current state.

private boolean buildBoxes()
Generate our +/- box images
